helpgrid.innerhtml: You can configure the map so it can be used by mobile devices. Maps can be configured to use Maximo Asset Management as a proxy. The proxy forwards mobile device map service requests to an ArcGIS Server.
Configure areas in the map that are accessible by offline mobile devices. Define the zoom level and extent for an area and then preview and download the map data.
You create a Google client identifier when you register with Google Maps API for Business. Specify a client identifier to use Google Map services.
Insert API-Key to use Google Map services.
You create a Bing Maps key by using the Bing Maps Account Center. Specify a Bing Maps key to use Bing Maps services.
Both URLs are based on the external geographic information system (GIS) servers. If the servers change, you must update the geocode service and the route service URLs.

If WebMap is not public, you must create and register a Web Mapping Application that includes the WebMap and acquire Client Id and Secret information and enter them under Map Security under OAuth 2.0 authentication. If there are any Token Secured ArcGIS Servers that contain Map or Feature Services, you must also include Username and Password under Map Security or under each individual Map or Feature Servers that requires a token listed under Map Services.

You can enable token-based authentication for this map manager. If authentication is enabled, user requests sent to the ArcGIS server will include an encrypted security token used to authorize the request. Specify a default user name and password to use for all requests associated with this map manager.

If token-based authentication is enabled, you can specify a user name and password to use for all requests associated with this map service. If you specify credentials for a map service, those credentials are used in place of any default credentials specified for the map manager.
Create a GIS object and define its relationship to a Maximo object. GIS objects refer to a feature class. GIS object names must be unique.
Enter the JSON mapper names for the GIS Object
Add map tips to provide additional information about records on the map. Map tips are displayed in an information window on a map.
The template defines the information that is displayed in an information window on a map. The content of the template is defined by the selected object.

If token-based authentication is enabled, you can specify a user name and password to use for the Geocode Services. If you specify credentials for a geocode service, those credentials are used in place of any default credentials specified in the map manager main tab under Map security section.

If token-based authentication is enabled, you can specify a user name and password to use for the Geometry Service. If you specify credentials for the geometry service, those credentials are used in place of any default credentials specified in the map manager main tab under Map security section.

If token-based authentication is enabled, you can specify a user name and password to use for the Print and Export Service. If you specify credentials for the print and export service, those credentials are used in place of any default credentials specified in the map manager main tab under Map security section.
Configure labels that are placed on the map. Labels are placed on the map when an unlinked feature is placed on the map by the Auto Locate function.
Each estimate is unique to the user that is currently logged in.
Select the layers you want to enable/disable.
Select the layers you want to associate with the service layer.
Select the attributes you want to define for the GIS and resource Maximo objects.
Select the Map Services you want to associate with the service layer.
Select the user defined object.
Select the user defined object.
